Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Cyclic L27-11 (protegrin-1-mimetic; PG-1 deirved, Lys-rich; synthetic AMPs20; XXD; XXC; UCBB1ad;  BBomp: new derivatives: POL7080, Murepavadin)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active in the nanomolar range against Gram-negative Pseudomonas spp (MIC: P. aeruginosa PAO1, 0.004 ug/ml; ATCC 27853 0.01 ug/ml );  moderately active against E. coli ATCC 259922 (MIC 64 ug/ml).Structure:You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.MOA:bacteria:  this peptide targets bacterial outer membrane protein LptD of Pseudomonas sp.Peptide engineering: Murepavadin, also known as POL7080, is a lipidated protegrin-1 mimetic.In vivo PK:mice: to be added.Clinical trials: Unfortunately, it failed at the advanced level of clincial trial.Entry history: The original has been replaced. Updated 5/2016;10/2017; 7/2021; 5/2024

Literature Information.Title: Peptidomimetic antibiotics target outer-membrane biogenesis in Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
